summary: Technical problem affecting access to disk storage systems.

updates.details: We currently have a technical problem affecting at least the archive disk volumes, possibly other disk systems as well, so ALL disk storage systems are potentially affected. The team is currently investigating as a matter of urgency. So far we believe this is unrelated to Cloudflare issues reported in the media.

The cause of the issue has been identified and stopped. Some data in the CEDA archive is currently unavailable. We will provide a detailed update as to which data, and a timeline to restoration, as soon as possible. Please note all other CEDA and JASMIN remain operational.

As part of the migration of data in the CEDA archive, a mistake was made which resulted in some data being deleted from the archive. As a result of this incident, approximately 5 Petabytes of data have been deleted from the archive. We are beginning the process of prioritising data for recovery from backup.
We have given an update on the incident and answered some common asked questions, including how to request which data youâ€™d like to be a priority for recovery.

summary: Node reboots to clear stuck processes.

updates.details: Following some (now resolved) issues with SOF storage last week, Globus nodes are being rebooted this afternoon to clear stuck processes. Transfer tasks currently waiting should resume in due course.
Globus transfer nodes now rebooted, transfers now running again.
